backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the CyberCase Manager backend, defining types (Case, IncidentReport, UserProfile, roles, severity) and implementing user registration, role management, case CRUD, incident reporting, and note/assignment operations with role-based access control.
feature_evidence.json: A feature evidence report JSON file with an empty features array, used to track implemented features.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: A JSON-formatted text file containing one-sentence summaries of each frontend source file, documenting the purpose and key changes made to each component, page, and hook.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS entry point that imports Tailwind directives and defines CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens (background, foreground, card, chart colors, sidebar, etc.).
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the Vite/React app, setting the page title to 'CyberCase Manager' and mounting the React root at the #root div.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main application router using TanStack Router, defining routes with an authentication guard (AuthenticatedLayout), an admin-only guard (AdminLayout), profile setup modal trigger, and routes for dashboard, cases, incidents, analytics, and user management.
frontend/src/components/AnimatedBackgrou: Canvas-based animated background component that renders a scrolling grid, a horizontal scan line, and floating particles in a cyberpunk neon style.
Modal dialog component for creating a new security case, with fields for title, description, and severity, wired to the useCreateCase mutation hook with toast feedback.
frontend/src/components/IncidentTrendCha: Renders a 7-day area chart showing incidents vs resolved counts using Recharts, with a custom cyberpunk-styled tooltip.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main app layout wrapping a Sidebar and top header bar that displays system status, user profile/role, notifications, and a logout button.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: Modal dialog for first-time user registration that collects an operator name and calls the registerUser mutation to initialize a profile.
frontend/src/components/Sidebar.tsx: Collapsible navigation sidebar showing the app logo, system threat status, and nav links; conditionally includes a User Management link for admins.
frontend/src/components/StatCard.tsx: Reusable stat display card with a title, numeric value, icon, optional trend indicator, and configurable neon color theming.
frontend/src/components/ThreatFeedList.t: Scrollable live threat feed panel displaying a static list of mock threat items with severity badges, type labels, and timestamps.
frontend/src/components/UpdateStatusModa: A modal dialog component that allows users to update the status of a case by selecting from Open, In Progress, Resolved, or Closed options, then submitting via a mutation hook.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor using React Query, reinitializing and invalidating dependent queries whenever the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook that manage Internet Identity authentication state (login, logout, identity persistence) using DFINITY's AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Centralizes all React Query hooks for the backend, covering user profiles, roles, cases, and incident reports with queries and mutations that delegate to the ICP actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports Orbitron/Share Tech Mono fonts, defines a cyberpunk-themed design system with neon color tokens, and provides utility classes for neon glows, borders, and grid backgrounds.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider into the DOM root.
frontend/src/pages/AnalyticsPage.tsx: A dashboard page that visualizes case and incident data using Recharts pie and bar charts, showing distributions by severity, status, and incident type with a cyberpunk visual theme.
frontend/src/pages/CaseDetailPage.tsx: Displays detailed information for a single security case identified by route param, including notes and assignment. Allows authenticated users to add notes and admins to assign cases to analysts.
frontend/src/pages/CaseManagementPage.ts: Lists all security cases in a filterable table with severity and status filters. Admins can create, delete, and update case status via modals.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx: Main security dashboard showing stat cards for active threats, open/resolved cases, and total incidents, along with a trend chart and threat feed. Derives metrics from live case and incident data.
frontend/src/pages/IncidentReportingPage: Provides a form to submit new security incident reports (title, type, severity, affected systems) which automatically creates a tracking case. Also displays a table of all previously reported incidents.
frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx: Landing/login page featuring a hero banner, platform feature highlights, and an Internet Identity authentication button. Redirects already-authenticated users to the dashboard.
frontend/src/pages/UserManagementPage.ts: Admin-only React page that displays a table of all registered users with their roles, allows admins to change user roles via a dropdown with a confirmation dialog, and shows summary stats for total users, admins, and analysts.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility module providing functions to extract URL parameters from both regular query strings and hash-based routing, persist them to sessionStorage, and clean sensitive parameters from the URL hash without reloading.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining a cyberpunk-themed design system with custom neon/cyber color palettes, Orbitron and Share Tech Mono fonts, neon glow box shadows, and animation keyframes for accordion and glow effects.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file (schema v1.0.0, version 7) describing a cybersecurity case management system with features including dark cyberpunk UI, Internet Identity auth, threat dashboard, case management, and user management.
